content.description: CENTRAL BUSINESS DISTRICT DATA FOR A SMALL- TO MEDIUM-SIZED CITY IN 2019
content.question: Blocks with 5G cellular phone service 43 Blocks with free high-speed wireless Internet 16 Business units with access to fiber-optic Internet service 1038 Hotel rooms with free high-speed wireless Internet 925 Flexible workspace desks or offices available for rent 72 Which of the following best explains what the central business district data indicate?

choices.label: Business owners want to have fast Internet available for their consumers in order to improve online ratings for local services and generate return customers.
Consumers demand that the fastest Internet service available before they will consider visiting a city or selecting a hotel for work or business trips.
Politicians and activists have made Internet connectivity a basic right of urban residents and feel that governments should provide services to increase the connectivity of citizens.
Government policy makers and business partners have focused infrastructure efforts on creating a downtown work environment that is positive for economic development.
Communications companies expect that increasing Internet speeds will lead to increased number of subscribers to their networks.

content.answer: Government policy makers and business partners have focused infrastructure efforts on creating a downtown work environment that is positive for economic development.

unit.text: 6: Cities and Urban Land-Use Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain patterns and trends in maps and in quantitative and geospatial data to draw conclusions.
